author: Masamune Okami

text: @Zephryion Time is not unlimited, all I can say - I have taken my fair time drawing some of them and failed miserably somewhere in the halfway despite doing the seal otherwise just perfect. I haven't played neither of those two, but I know what they are about and I'd love to get my hand on one of them. I'm keeping an eye of a local game store's collection so if either one of them appears there second-hand I'm there to grab it in a swing of whip, so to speak. :P
author: sinituuke

text: @Zephryion Pretty funny, actually, I finished the normal game some months ago. Yes, practicing the seal drawing was the key to victory. I always seemed to take several tries to draw the seal in boss battles because I was a bit nervous but it never resulted as "game over" situation. Thank you for your cheering, though - I'll try to keep your words in mind next time I face trouble in video games. ;)
author: sinituuke

text: OMG this song is ingrained into my brain, I put too many hours into this game.
author: Camilo Garcia

text: Interesting that you uploaded this. I've just gotten in to this great series and I'm planning on getting Dawn of Sorrow in a few days. I can't wait to play it.
author: PaperMario15

text:
I started this game a few weeks ago, but quit playing once I reached he clock tower area. No, it's not that I don't like challenging areas. Drawing seals is more bothersome, and the one I'm supposed to draw next seems so complex I'm likely to fail it a few times on boss fight. I had to draw that Subterranean Hell boss seal one more than once, as well.

So, I started playing SotN instead. Certain familiar enemies have odd speed and tactics. Skeletons in particular - easy in DoS, annoying in SotN.
author: sinituuke
